overview_summary: The neighboring landowners are primarily private ranching and landholding entities with limited public information, indicating they are not large corporations. Two appear to be family-run ranch operations (one a limited partnership and another an LLC by a local ranch family), while the other two are LLCs likely formed for land investment with minimal community ties. None is a major business employer, but the longstanding ranch families among them may carry influence in local circles and could be cautious about new development near their lands.

neighbors.name: G & D Properties LLC
neighbors.claims: G & D Properties LLC is a Wyoming limited liability company that holds at least two parcels in Lincoln County and has no known business operations besides land ownership [City-Data](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/Kemmerer-WY.html). It does not appear in any state business or industry directories, suggesting it functions as a private land investment vehicle [NAICS Directory](https://naicslist.com/company-directory/state-wy?industry=531210).
neighbors.influence_justification: Unknown principals; no local business presence or community role documented

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via formal offer through their registered agent or mailing address, emphasizing favorable purchase or lease terms; they are likely financially motivated and not deeply tied to local politics

neighbors.name: Willis Land Wyoming LLC
neighbors.claims: Willis Land Wyoming LLC is an LLC that owns multiple parcels in the area but has no public-facing operations in Wyoming beyond holding land [City-Data](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/Kemmerer-WY.html). The company’s name suggests it was created to manage Wyoming property assets, and it has no listed local office or community engagement indicating out-of-town ownership.
neighbors.influence_justification: Out-of-area ownership; no local employment or known personal networks

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the ultimate owner (likely via public records) and reach out with a win-win proposal (e.g. buyout or easement benefits); appeal to their financial interest since they lack local sentimental ties

neighbors.name: Putnam Ranch, LLP
neighbors.claims: Putnam Ranch, LLP is a Wyoming registered limited partnership that holds ranch land in Lincoln County, indicating a family ranch operation structured for joint ownership or estate purposes [City-Data](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/Kemmerer-WY.html). It has no separate commercial business listings or subsidiaries, implying its activities are limited to managing and operating the ranch property.
neighbors.influence_justification: Established local ranch family; owns significant acreage; respected as longstanding landowners

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Putnam family directly with in-person meetings; address any concerns about how development might impact their ranching (water, fencing, livestock) and offer assurances or mitigation to maintain their support

neighbors.name: Pope Cattle Refuge LLC
neighbors.claims: Pope Cattle Refuge LLC is a Wyoming LLC formed in late 2012 by the local Pope ranch family of Cokeville ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-wy/pope-shield-llc--2012-000635392#:~:text=Wyoming%20,13%20years%20ago)). The Pope Ranch has been in operation since at least 2003 and remains a small-scale cattle ranch (fewer than five employees) incorporated in Wyoming [Manta](https://www.manta.com/c/mm3gjxz/pope-ranch). The use of “Refuge” in the name suggests an emphasis on land and wildlife preservation alongside cattle grazing, and there are no other business ventures under this entity.
neighbors.influence_justification: Multi-generation ranching family; local presence in Cokeville; values land conservation

approach_recommendations.engage: Work with the Pope family informally through trusted community channels; emphasize respect for their land stewardship and outline how the project can coexist with or even benefit their cattle and wildlife refuge goals
